	/// <summary>
	/// If the statement balances are credit or debit, the CreditDebitIndicator should be specified from the perspective of the Customer.
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public enum CreditDebitIndicator
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		CREDIT = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		DEBIT = 1,
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// 3 letter alpha code for the ISO-4217 currency code, e.g. USD, AUD.

	/// <summary>
	/// The StartBalance plus all the Statement Line Amounts should be equal to the EndBalance Amount.
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class EndBalance
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="amount")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> Amount { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// If the statement balances are credit or debit, the CreditDebitIndicator should be specified from the perspective of the Customer.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="creditDebitIndicator")]
		public CreditDebitIndicator CreditDebitIndicator { get; set; }
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// On error, the API consumer will receive an HTTP response with a HTTP Status Code of 4xx or 5xx and a Content-Type of application/problem+json.
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class Error
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Human readable detailed error description.
		/// Maximum: 255
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="detail")]
		public string Detail { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// The numeric HTTP Status Code, e.g. 404
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="status")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> Status { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Human readable high level error description.
		/// Maximum: 255
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="title")]
		public string Title { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Identifies the type of error.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="type")]
		public System.Nullable<ErrorType> Type { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public enum ErrorType
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-request")]
		invalidMinusrequest = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-application")]
		invalidMinusapplication = 1,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-feed-connection")]
		invalidMinusfeedMinusconnection = 2,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="duplicate-statement")]
		duplicateMinusstatement = 3,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-end-balance")]
		invalidMinusendMinusbalance = 4,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-start-and-end-date")]
		invalidMinusstartMinusandMinusendMinusdate = 5,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-start-date")]
		invalidMinusstartMinusdate = 6,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="internal-error")]
		internalMinuserror = 7,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="feed-already-connected-in-current-organisation")]
		feedMinusalreadyMinusconnectedMinusinMinuscurrentMinusorganisation = 8,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-end-date")]
		invalidMinusendMinusdate = 9,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="statement-not-found")]
		statementMinusnotMinusfound = 10,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="feed-connected-in-different-organisation")]
		feedMinusconnectedMinusinMinusdifferentMinusorganisation = 11,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="feed-already-connected-in-different-organisation")]
		feedMinusalreadyMinusconnectedMinusinMinusdifferentMinusorganisation = 12,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="bank-feed-not-found")]
		bankMinusfeedMinusnotMinusfound = 13,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-country-specified")]
		invalidMinuscountryMinusspecified = 14,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-organisation-bank-feeds")]
		invalidMinusorganisationMinusbankMinusfeeds = 15,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-organisation-multi-currency")]
		invalidMinusorganisationMinusmultiMinuscurrency = 16,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-feed-connection-for-organisation")]
		invalidMinusfeedMinusconnectionMinusforMinusorganisation = 17,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="invalid-user-role")]
		invalidMinususerMinusrole = 18,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="account-not-valid")]
		accountMinusnotMinusvalid = 19,
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class FeedConnection
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Xero identifier for a bank account in Xero. Must be included if AccountNumber is not specified.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="accountId")]
		public string AccountId { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// The Account Name will be used for the creation of a new Xero Bank Account if a matching Xero Bank Account is not found.
		/// Maximum: 30
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="accountName")]
		public string AccountName { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// String(40) when AccountType is BANK String(4) when AccountType is CREDITCARD The Account Number is used to match the feed to a Xero Bank Account. The API will create a new Xero Bank Account if a match to an existing Xero Bank Account is not found. Only the last 4 digits must be supplied for Credit Card numbers. Must be included if AccountId is not specified.
		/// Maximum: 40
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="accountNumber")]
		public string AccountNumber { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// This account identifier is generated by the financial institute (FI). This must be unique for your financial institute.
		/// Maximum: 50
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="accountToken")]
		public string AccountToken { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// High level bank account type - BANK CREDITCARD BANK encompasses all bank account types other than credit cards.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="accountType")]
		public System.Nullable<FeedConnectionAccountType> AccountType { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code, e.g. US, AU This element is required only when the Application supports multi-region. Talk to your Partner Manager to confirm if this is the case.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="country")]
		public CountryCode Country { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// 3 letter alpha code for the ISO-4217 currency code, e.g. USD, AUD.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="currency")]
		public System.Nullable<FeedConnectionCurrency> Currency { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// On error, the API consumer will receive an HTTP response with a HTTP Status Code of 4xx or 5xx and a Content-Type of application/problem+json.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="error")]
		public Error Error { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// GUID used to identify the Account.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="id")]
		public string Id { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// the current status of the feed connection
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="status")]
		public System.Nullable<FeedConnectionStatus> Status { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public enum FeedConnectionAccountType
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		BANK = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		CREDITCARD = 1,
	}

	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public enum FeedConnectionStatus
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		PENDING = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		REJECTED = 1,
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class FeedConnections
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="items")]
		public FeedConnection[] Items { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="pagination")]
		public Pagination Pagination { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class Pagination
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Number of items returned
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="itemCount")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> ItemCount { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Page number which specifies the set of records to retrieve. Example - https://api.xero.com/bankfeeds.xro/1.0/Statements?page=2 to get the second set of the records. When page value is not a number or a negative number, by default, the first set of records is returned.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="page")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> Page { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Number of pages available
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="pageCount")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> PageCount { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Page size which specifies how many records per page will be returned (default 50). Example - https://api.xero.com/bankfeeds.xro/1.0/Statements?pageSize=100 to specify page size of 100.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="pageSize")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> PageSize { get; set; }
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// The starting balance of the statement
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class StartBalance
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// decimal(19,4) unsigned Opening/closing balance amount.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="amount")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> Amount { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// If the statement balances are credit or debit, the CreditDebitIndicator should be specified from the perspective of the Customer.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="creditDebitIndicator")]
		public CreditDebitIndicator CreditDebitIndicator { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class Statement
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// The StartBalance plus all the Statement Line Amounts should be equal to the EndBalance Amount.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="endBalance")]
		public EndBalance EndBalance { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Closing balance date ISO-8601 YYYY-MM-DD
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="endDate")]
		public System.Nullable<System.DateOnly> EndDate { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="errors")]
		public Error[] Errors { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// The Xero generated feed connection Id that identifies the Xero Bank Account Container into which the statement should be delivered. This is obtained by calling GET FeedConnections.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="feedConnectionId")]
		public string FeedConnectionId { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// GUID used to identify the Statement.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="id")]
		public string Id { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// The starting balance of the statement
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="startBalance")]
		public StartBalance StartBalance { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Opening balance date (can be no older than one year from the current date) ISO-8601 YYYY-MM-DD
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="startDate")]
		public System.Nullable<System.DateOnly> StartDate { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="statementLineCount")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> StatementLineCount { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="statementLines")]
		public StatementLine[] StatementLines { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Current status of statements
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="status")]
		public System.Nullable<StatementStatus> Status { get; set; }
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// the lines details for a statement
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class StatementLine
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Transaction amount
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="amount")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Double> Amount { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// The cheque/check number
		/// Maximum: 20
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="chequeNumber")]
		public string ChequeNumber { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// If the statement balances are credit or debit, the CreditDebitIndicator should be specified from the perspective of the Customer.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="creditDebitIndicator")]
		public CreditDebitIndicator CreditDebitIndicator { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Transaction description
		/// Maximum: 2000
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="description")]
		public string Description { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Typically the merchant or payee name
		/// Maximum: 255
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="payeeName")]
		public string PayeeName { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// The date that the transaction was processed or cleared as seen in internet banking ISO-8601 YYYY-MM-DD
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="postedDate")]
		public System.Nullable<System.DateOnly> PostedDate { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Optional field to enhance the Description
		/// Maximum: 255
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="reference")]
		public string Reference { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Financial institute's internal transaction identifier. If provided this field is factored into duplicate detection.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="transactionId")]
		public string TransactionId { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public enum StatementStatus
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		PENDING = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		REJECTED = 1,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		DELIVERED = 2,
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/04")]
	public class Statements
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="items")]
		public Statement[] Items { get; set; }
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="pagination")]
		public Pagination Pagination { get; set; }
	}
	
	public partial class Misc
	{
		
		private System.Net.Http.HttpClient httpClient;
		
		private JsonSerializerOptions jsonSerializerSettings;
		
		public Misc(System.Net.Http.HttpClient httpClient, JsonSerializerOptions jsonSerializerSettings=null)
		{
			if (httpClient == null)
				throw new ArgumentNullException("Null HttpClient.", "httpClient");

			if (httpClient.BaseAddress == null)
				throw new ArgumentNullException("HttpClient has no BaseAddress", "httpClient");

			this.httpClient = httpClient;
			this.jsonSerializerSettings = jsonSerializerSettings;
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Searches for feed connections
		/// By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for available feed connections in the system.
		/// GetFeedConnections FeedConnections
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="page">Page number which specifies the set of records to retrieve. By default the number of the records per set is 10. Example - https://api.xero.com/bankfeeds.xro/1.0/FeedConnections?page=1 to get the second set of the records. When page value is not a number or a negative number, by default, the first set of records is returned.</param>
		/// <param name="pageSize">Page size which specifies how many records per page will be returned (default 10). Example - https://api.xero.com/bankfeeds.xro/1.0/FeedConnections?pageSize=100 to specify page size of 100.</param>
		public async Task GetFeedConnectionsAsync(int page, int pageSize, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "FeedConnections?page="+page+"&pageSize="+pageSize;
			using var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri);
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Create one or more new feed connection
		/// By passing in the FeedConnections array object in the body, you can create one or more new feed connections
		/// CreateFeedConnections FeedConnections
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="requestBody">Feed Connection(s) array object in the body</param>
		public async Task CreateFeedConnectionsAsync(FeedConnections requestBody, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "FeedConnections";
			using var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Post, requestUri);
			var content = System.Net.Http.Json.JsonContent.Create(requestBody, mediaType: null, jsonSerializerSettings);
			httpRequestMessage.Content = content;
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Delete an existing feed connection
		/// By passing in FeedConnections array object in the body, you can delete a feed connection.
		/// DeleteFeedConnections FeedConnections/DeleteRequests
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="requestBody">Feed Connections array object in the body</param>
		public async Task DeleteFeedConnectionsAsync(FeedConnections requestBody, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "FeedConnections/DeleteRequests";
			using var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Post, requestUri);
			var content = System.Net.Http.Json.JsonContent.Create(requestBody, mediaType: null, jsonSerializerSettings);
			httpRequestMessage.Content = content;
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Retrieve single feed connection based on a unique id provided
		/// By passing in a FeedConnection Id options, you can search for matching feed connections
		/// GetFeedConnection FeedConnections/{id}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="id">Unique identifier for retrieving single object</param>
		/// <returns>success returns a FeedConnection object matching the id in response</returns>
		public async Task<FeedConnection> GetFeedConnectionAsync(string id, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "FeedConnections/"+ (id==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(id));
			using var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri);
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var streamContent = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<FeedConnection>(streamContent, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Retrieve all statements
		/// By passing in parameters, you can search for matching statements
		/// GetStatements Statements
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="page">unique id for single object</param>
		/// <param name="pageSize">Page size which specifies how many records per page will be returned (default 10). Example - https://api.xero.com/bankfeeds.xro/1.0/Statements?pageSize=100 to specify page size of 100.</param>
		/// <returns>success returns Statements array of objects response</returns>
		public async Task<Statements> GetStatementsAsync(int page, int pageSize, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "Statements?page="+page+"&pageSize="+pageSize;
			using var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri);
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var streamContent = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<Statements>(streamContent, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Creates one or more new statements
		/// CreateStatements Statements
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="requestBody">Statements array of objects in the body</param>
		public async Task CreateStatementsAsync(Statements requestBody, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "Statements";
			using var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Post, requestUri);
			var content = System.Net.Http.Json.JsonContent.Create(requestBody, mediaType: null, jsonSerializerSettings);
			httpRequestMessage.Content = content;
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Retrieve single statement based on unique id provided
		/// By passing in a statement id, you can search for matching statements
		/// GetStatement Statements/{statementID}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="statementId">statement id for single object</param>
		/// <returns>search results matching id for single statement</returns>
		public async Task<Statement> GetStatementAsync(string statementId, string statementID, Action<System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders> handleHeaders = null)
		{
			var requestUri = "Statements/"+ (statementID==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(statementID))+"?statementId=" + (statementId==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(statementId));
			using var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri);
			if (handleHeaders != null)
			{
				handleHeaders(httpRequestMessage.Headers);
			}

			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var streamContent = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStreamAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<Statement>(streamContent, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
		}
	}
}

namespace Fonlow.Net.Http
{
	using System.Net.Http;

	public class WebApiRequestException : HttpRequestException
	{
		public new System.Net.HttpStatusCode StatusCode { get; private set; }

		public string Response { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders Headers { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue ContentType { get; private set; }

		public WebApiRequestException(string message, System.Net.HttpStatusCode statusCode, string response, System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders headers, System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue contentType) : base(message)
		{
			StatusCode = statusCode;
			Response = response;
			Headers = headers;
			ContentType = contentType;
		}
	}

	public static class ResponseMessageExtensions
	{
		public static void EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx(this HttpResponseMessage responseMessage)
		{
			if (!responseMessage.IsSuccessStatusCode)
			{
				var responseText = responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync().Result;
				var contentType = responseMessage.Content.Headers.ContentType;
				throw new WebApiRequestException(responseMessage.ReasonPhrase, responseMessage.StatusCode, responseText, responseMessage.Headers, contentType);
			}
		}
	}
}
